intro: Bakeriella kemoensis, commonly known as the Kemoensis Bakeriella, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires a cool, moist climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
